item.title: Linux | Install Windows 7
item.description: Brief Some things just are better on windows than linux thus having a windows virtual machine(VM) is a great idea specially when daily driving linux. We will be using Vert Manager to use windows 7 on vanilla Debian linux however, this will work on any Debian based system i.e Ubuntu. Machine I am using: Step 1: Confirm virtualization Open terminal and type grep -o "vm\|sum" /proc/cpuinfo here the command outputs ‘vmx’ but if u are not using intel processor it will show ‘SVM’ instead.
